metadata.Description: Assessments that evaluate the cultural impact of a project or development on a community or society.

level 1.Description: Cultural impact assessments implement building standards that consider the cultural significance of a project.
Cultural impact assessments provide funding for community engagement programs to ensure the inclusion of diverse cultural perspectives.
Cultural impact assessments focus on understanding and addressing the impacts of projects on indigenous communities.
Cultural impact assessments are conducted as part of the broader environmental impact assessments to evaluate the cultural implications of a project.
Cultural impact assessments partner with archaeological experts to assess the potential impact of a project on archaeological sites and artifacts.
Cultural impact assessments contribute to the achievement of sustainable development goals by ensuring the preservation of cultural heritage and promoting cultural diversity.
Cultural impact assessments monitor the impact of projects on cultural heritage sites and implement mitigation measures to minimize negative effects.
Cultural impact assessments target the implementation of cultural sensitivity training programs for project stakeholders to enhance cultural understanding and respect.
Cultural impact assessments address the preservation of cultural heritage by identifying measures to protect and conserve significant cultural sites and practices.

level 2.Subject: environmental impact assessments
level 2.Description: Environmental impact assessments align with environmental regulations to ensure compliance and minimize the negative environmental impacts of energy projects.
